WorkItem.ClosedComment: getElementsByTagName does return a NodeList. While some browsers do return an HTMLCollection, that behavior isn't universal.
WorkItem.Description:
Most of the declarations of methods like getElementsByTagName return a NodeList (of course in the file lib.d.ts). 

By declaring that it returns a HTMLCollection instead (like also officially stated in the new DOM4 API), helps the typing system in understanding that we talk about Elements and not just any Node.

-- Peter
WorkItem.Summary: Use more often HTMLCollection instead of NodeList
